properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 3 at 2:50AM MST until February 4 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Rapid City SD
properties.description:
A winter storm system will bring snow to northeastern Wyoming
and the Black Hills area today. Snow amounts of greater than 6
inches are expected across parts of the northeastern Wyoming
plains, the Bear Lodge Mountains, and the northern to central
Black Hills. Forecast snow amounts taper off fairly quickly from
the foothills of the Black Hills to the adjacent plains of
southwestern South Dakota. The snow will gradually decrease this
afternoon, but could linger across parts of the northeastern
Wyoming plains and far southwestern South Dakota into Monday
evening.

* WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches.

* WHERE...The Fall River County Plains and the Southern Foot
Hills.

* WHEN...Until midnight MST tonight.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MST TONIGHT
